episodes.title: Episode 50: Making Friends After Leaving a Cultish Environment
episodes.description:
I had a conversation with a good friend recently about leaving cults. She is also a cult survivor. She asked me a little bit about my story and how I made friends once I left the cult. And I realized, I have never discussed this before and it is really important topic!

So many people feel alone and may truly be alone after leaving religious abuse. So what do you do? How to do trust anyone again? How do you know what kind of friends you do and don't want? Well today, we are going to talk about it!⁠

Join the ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Warriors Community Patreon⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ for weekly updates on the ongoing case against the cult I was in, along with deeper conversations and a chance to create and interact with me and a community of people. ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠

If you have any questions or comments about today's episode, please feel free to reach out and chat! You can find me on instagram at ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠@⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Mrs. Liza Lovett⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠. You can also send an email to thewarriorscommunity1@gmail.com

Click the affiliate link to purchase my new book:

⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Whispers of The Lake⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠.

episodes.title: Episode 47: Redeeming Power in Abuse
episodes.description: Recently, I read a powerful book about abuse in the church that was so impactful, I have to share it! I also happened to be reading this book at the perfect time when I went through a personal experience that this book directly speaks to. There are a lot of powerful tools and resources in today's episode! This episode is specifically for victims of abuse who feel unheard, unseen, unbelieved, dismissed, or who have experienced harassment, stalking, threats, or blackmail for speaking out. Please Note: This conversation just scratches the surface. There is so much more to this conversation than what we discuss today. Website Links Referred to in Today's Episode: ⁠Diane Landburg Mary Demuth End Violence Against Women International Blogs I Wrote on Today's Topic: Why Do Survivors Take So Long To Talk About What Happened? How To Better Respond To Survivors of Abuse in The Church Shifting the Culture: How the Church can Support Victims of Sexual Abuse Affiliate Links to the Books Referred to Today: Redeeming Power: Understanding Authority and Abuse in the Church - Diane Landburg We Too - Mary Demuth Join the ⁠⁠⁠⁠The Warriors Community Patreon⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ for weekly updates on the ongoing case against the cult I was in, along with deeper conversations and a chance to create and interact with me and a community of people. ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ If you have any questions or comments about today's episode, please feel free to reach out and chat! episodes.title: Episode 45: Vytautas' Story - Purity Streak
episodes.description: Disclaimer: Not all of the views, beliefs, and core values expressed by guests on this podcast necessarily reflect the view, beliefs, and core values of Liza Lovett or the Warriors Community. I found today's guest on Medium.com. I have read many of his articles and really loved them. In the last decade, I have had too many conversations with people who were damaged or confused by the purity culture movement in the church. Too many people have come forward with sexual abuse stories despite such conservative or extreme purity teachings in the church. Vytautas writes about purity in the church in such an intentional, careful, and Biblical way. So! I invited him to speak on the podcast. Article Referred to in Today's Episode: ⁠3 Reasons Why Christian Men Shouldn’t Hold Women Responsible for Dressing in a Suggestive Way⁠ Read more of ⁠Vytautas Ratkevičius ⁠ articles on Medium.com Join the ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Warriors Community Patreon⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ for weekly updates on the ongoing case against the cult I was in, along with deeper conversations and a chance to create and interact with me and a community of people. ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ If you have any questions or comments about today's episode, please feel free to reach out and chat! episodes.title: Episode 41: How Do You Respond When People Attack You?
episodes.description: Disclaimer: Not all of the views, beliefs, and core values expressed by guests on this podcast necessarily reflect the view, beliefs, and core values of Liza Lovett or the Warriors Community. This conversation is a topic I've wrestled with recently and a topic I am sure everyone can relate to struggling with now and then. I am talking about what happens when people attack you. How do you respond? What do you give space to or open yourself up to when you are being attacked? What happens in your head and your heart? Due to recent events, I had to take a step back, check my heart, check my stance, and spend a lot of time on my knees in prayer. I wrestled through a lot of hurt and anger and I want to take time to share that with you and how I came to the healthy place I am in now. episodes.title: Episode 40: Mending Relationships After Leaving a Cult
episodes.description: Disclaimer: Not all of the views, beliefs, and core values expressed by guests on this podcast necessarily reflect the view, beliefs, and core values of Liza Lovett or the Warriors Community. We don't talk much about what happens when you leave religious abuse and how difficult it is to mend broken and estranged relationships. Today, I want want to share part of my story in mending relationships. The road is not easy! But it is worth it. ⁠⁠⁠Link to Article Referred to in Today's Episode: Cults Break Up Families Join the ⁠⁠⁠The Warriors Community Patreon⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ for weekly updates on the ongoing case against the cult I was in, along with deeper conversations and a chance to create and interact with me and a community of people. ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠ If you have any questions or comments about today's episode, please feel free to reach out and chat! episodes.title: Episode 39: Burning Butterflies Podcast Host Shares Her Story: Leaving a Cult
episodes.description: Disclaimer: Not all of the views, beliefs, and core values expressed by guests on this podcast necessarily reflect the view, beliefs, and core values of Liza Lovett or the Warriors Community. I've mentioned a podcast I discovered a few months ago on the podcast before. And now I have one of the podcast hosts joining me today! Amanda Turnbull is co-host of the Burning Butterflies Podcast where she and her co-host talk about their journey through a cult. They start at the very beginning and take you through it all! When I first listened to the Burning Butterflies podcast, I was amazed at how deeply I could relate to each episode. Today, Amanda shares part of her story about her experience in a cult and how she disentangled her beliefs once she left. episodes.title: Episode 37: Questions to Help Determine What is and Isn't a Cult
episodes.description: Disclaimer: Not all of the views, beliefs, and core values expressed by guests on this podcast necessarily reflect the view, beliefs, and core values of Liza Lovett or the Warriors Community. The last two weeks, we have focused a lot on the BITE Model, which is a resource that is extremely helpful for anyone who has been involved in cultish environments. Today, I go over a list of questions from Dr. Steven Hassans. (who developed the BITE model) to help determine whether or not you are in a cultish environment. episodes.title: Episode 36: My Story - What Made me Vulnerable to a Cult
episodes.description: Disclaimer: Not all of the views, beliefs, and core values expressed by guests on this podcast necessarily reflect the view, beliefs, and core values of Liza Lovett or the Warriors Community. I want to go back. I mean way back! And share with you some personal experiences that put me at risk for joining a cult. I will also share with you some resources to help you identify what may put you at risk. And, I share some characteristics of cults to look for when joining a new church or other organization.
